cheatsheet.title: Creating a new plot in Debrief

intro.description: This tutorial will lead you through creating a new, blank plot in Debrief.

item.title: Check you have a Project
item.description: Before you can create a Plot, you must have a Project into which the Plot is created. If you haven't created a project, go to the "Generating a project" cheatsheet, then return here.

item.title: Create new plot
item.description: Select [File/New/Debrief Plot] and the Wizard will open. Once the wizard opens, the first step is to specify where you would like the plot to be stored (it's Container. So, click on Browse button and select the top-level folder of your data directories. Also provide a filename. From the wizard, follow the series of tabs to indicate what information you'd like shown in the background of the plot, clicking Finish to complete. Some of the steps will not advance until all of the necessary fields have been filled.

item.title: Finished
item.description: Once the Wizard has closed, the plot you've created can be found in the folder you specified (Summer 09: an unresolved bug is preventing the plot from opening itself on completion).
